An epic tale of family, faith, power and oil set on the incendiary 
frontier of California&#039;s turn-of-the-century petroleum boom. The 
story chronicles the life and times of one Daniel Plainview, who  
transforms himself from a down-and-out silver miner raising a son 
on his own into a self-made oil tycoon. When Plainview gets a 
mysterious tip-off that there&#039;s a little town out West where an 
ocean of oil is oozing out of the ground, he heads with his son, 
H.W., to take their chances in dust-worn Little Boston. In this 
hardscrabble town, where the main excitement centers around the 
holy roller church of charismatic preacher Eli Sunday, Plainview 
and H.W. make their lucky strike. But even as the well raises all 
of their fortunes, nothing will remain the same as conflicts 
escalate and every human value--love, hope, community, belief, 
ambition and even the bond between father and son--is imperiled by 
corruption, deception and the flow of oil.
